doc.after: Though similar to Palaeopropithecus, Archaeoindris was significantly larger and more robust.[5][14] Archaeoindris was one of the largest primates to ever evolve,[10] and was the largest-known strepsirrhine primate,[13] weighing an estimated 160Â kg (350Â lb).[2] It was roughly the size of an adult male gorilla,[12] which was first noted by Lamberton.[20]
